Dear Mr. VanderLoon:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
03/02/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
R 400.4167 (4) Case record maintenance.
(4) Records shall be maintained in a uniform and
organized manner, shall be protected against
destruction and damage, and shall be stored in a
manner that safeguards confidentiality.
At the time of the onset of the inspection all three currently placed youth's files
were placed out in the open and not stored in a manner that safeguards
confidentiality.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection dated 03/04/2022, CAP approval dated 03/03/2022.
2

R 400.4152 (1) (c) Initial documentation.
At the time of admission, all of the following shall be in
the resident’s case record:
(c) A brief description of the resident’s preparation for
placement and general physical and emotional state at
the time of admission.
Three out of three currently placed youth files reviewed were missing information
on the youth's preparation and current physical and emotional state at the time of
admission.
R 400.4166 (1) (b) Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional
care, all of the following information shall be
documented in the case record within 14 days after
discharge:
(b) A brief summary or other documentation of the
services provided while in residence, including medical
and dental services.
Eight out of eight closed files reviewed did not contain information in discharge
planning that included a summarization of the services provided while placed at
the facility.
R 400.4166 (1) (c) Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional
care, all of the following information shall be
documented in the case record within 14 days after
discharge:
(c) An assessment of the resident’s needs that remain
to be met..
Eight out of eight closed files reviewed did not contain information summarizing
the facilities assessment of remaining needs to be met for the youth after
discharge.
R 400.4166 (1) (e) Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional
care, all of the following information shall be
documented in the case record within 14 days after
discharge:
(e) A statement that the discharge plan
3

recommendations, including medical and dental follow
up that is needed, have been reviewed with the
resident and with the parent and with the responsible
case manager.
Seven out of eight closed files reviewed did not contain any confirmation that the
discharge information was reviewed with the youth and their parent/caregiver and
responsible case manager.
R 400.4166 (1) (f) Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional
care, all of the following information shall be
documented in the case record within 14 days after
discharge:
(f) The name and official title of the person to whom the
resident was discharged.
Four out of eight closed files reviewed did not contain clear information on the
name and title to whom the youth had been discharged.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The inspection completed on 02/17/2022 contained 4 rule violation findings. A
corrective action plan was submitted and approved on 03/03/2022.
Only one corrective action plan occurred during the period under review as a result
of a special investigation (SIR #2023C0000032). Elements of this CAP involved
4

new policies and procedures to ensure proper supervision of youth at night.
Through unannounced visits and communication with staff at the facility it has been
confirmed that elements of the CAP are being followed and have been beneficial.
Financial Overview
Yearly budgeting and auditing for the facility was provided by the overseeing
organization and no concerns were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Annual Assessment was received and reviewed on 03/14/2023.
The facility assessed that they have been able to work together as a full staff to
work towards compliance of any CCI rules and their own policies. Unplanned
discharges were analyzed and are largely only occurring for one reason, AWOLs
from youth that are not able to be accepted back in to the facility. Elements of the
Corrective Action Plan approved for the 2022 inspection were reviewed. The Chief
Administrator stated that all the action steps previously committed to for any
previous rule violations are continuously being utilized by current staff as well as
new hires.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were completed on 03/08/2023. Staff reported enjoyment and
support working for the facility, but also provided feedback on training needs and
ongoing need for presence from management in the building. Staff interviews were
completed on 03/02/2023 and 03/08/2023. All youth reported feeling safe and
adequately cared for at the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Facility walkthrough was completed on 03/02/2023 during an unannounced visit to
the facility. The building was in good repair and clean. Bedrooms were viewed and
updates from the most recent CAP were confirmed, including new nightlights for
viewing youth sleeping at night. Security system upgrades were discussed.
Review of safety items in various locations of the building occurred and all were
secured properly. A crawlspace beneath the lower floor was viewed and no safety
concerns were noted. It was discovered during the walkthrough that files for
currently placed youth were not placed in a secure, locked setting in order to
protect confidentiality.
5

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
